One's own mind is not of the nature of self, person, sentient being, or life-force, etc.

The nature of self, person, etc.,

Self, person, etc. are originally non-existent.

One thus becomes free from all views of self.

The World-Honored One said:
The mind does not dwell within, nor without, nor in between.
Why is this?
Because it is originally pure and free from discrimination.
Thus observing, one knows that one's own mind is selfless and equal.
One understands that all dharmas are originally unborn.
Free from deluded discrimination,

Deludedly giving rise to inverted discrimination, they are devoured by ghosts and spirits.

To enable sentient beings to awaken to their own minds,
